resources.string: In a town, each house either produces electricity (producer house) or consumes electricity (consumer house). You want to find the longest continuous stretch of houses where the total electricity balances out (no surplus, no deficit).

You are given a sequence of fuel events along a straight highway. Each event is an integer: a positive number means fuel is added at that station (refill), and a negative number means fuel is consumed to travel that segment (cost). Starting with 0 fuel at the first station of a considered stretch, the running fuel balance after visiting each successive station in the stretch must never become negative. 

 Find the longest contiguous stretch (subarray) of stations such that, if you start at the first station of that stretch with zero fuel, the cumulative fuel balance remains ≥ 0 at every step inside the stretch. 
 
 Return the length of that longest stretch and the positions (indices) of its first and last stations using 1-based indexing. If there is no non-empty valid stretch (i.e., every single-station start leads to immediate negative balance), return 0 -1 -1

You’re planning a road trip with your family. Along the highway, there are hotels in sequence, and each hotel has a different nightly rate depending on amenities, demand, and location. You want to book a stretch of consecutive nights (one hotel per night) such that the total stay cost fits within your travel budget, while maximizing the number of nights.
The Longest Stretch Hotel Starts from %1$d to %2$d and total nights are %3$s
A server is handling incoming video play requests per second (some light, some heavy). Find the maximum number of consecutive seconds where the total requests stay within the allowed server capacity.
The Longest Consecutive Requests Starts from %1$d to %2$d and total seconds are %3$s
Find the next larger box for each box in the incoming conveyor (Warehouse Delivery Boxes)

A regional fulfillment warehouse receives mixed batches of empty shipping cartons on a conveyor belt. To reduce pallet height, protect fragile items, and speed up downstream packing, staff want to automatically identify opportunities to nest smaller cartons into the next larger carton that appears later on the conveyor. This matching is used by the packing robot and operators to decide whether to nest, hold for a different shipment, or mark for repack.
Weather Station — Wind Gusts: Minutes Until Next Stronger Gust

Your weather station samples wind gust speed in kilometers per hour (km/h) once every minute. For each recorded gust, determine how many minutes you must wait until a later gust is strictly stronger than the current one. If there is no later gust that is strictly stronger, return 0 for that reading.
River Gauge — Nearest Previous Higher Water Level

For a given river gauge, a stream of water-level readings arrives every minute. For each new reading, output the most recent earlier reading that was strictly higher; if none exists, output none. Process the stream online — produce the answer as each reading arrives.

Given a playlist (an ordered list of songs), find the longest continuous segment (contiguous subsequence) of the playlist that contains no duplicate songs. A duplicate means the same song identifier appears more than once inside the considered segment.
Add a gust speed to the list
Compute how many minutes until a stronger gust
Please enter a numeric gust speed
Enter a gust speed between 0 and 1000
Please describe the issue and steps to reproduce or share your common feedback
